description: This popular tank pool hosts both structured aquatic lessons as well as recreational swim times.
transit: Travel to Scarborough Centre Station. Board the 130 Middlefield and travel to Invergordon. On the northbound side of McCowan, board the 129 Mccowan North and travel to Sandhurst N Walk west to 1550 Sandhurst Circle.

description: Alderwood Pool is a part of the Alderwood Centre, located in the Horner/Brown's Line area. Our centre features amenities such as Alderwood Pool, the Toronto Public Library - Alderwood Branch and Sir Adam Beck Public School. Alderwood is pleased to offer a broad spectrum of innovative aquatic and fitness programs for persons of all ages and abilities. This includes a large learn-to-swim program, extensive and varied aquafit program, and leisure/lane swimming. Please come visit and experience the best Alderwood has to offer!
transit: Travel to Islington Station. Board the 110A Islington South and travel to the Farside of Horner. Walk west to Orianna Drive and then north to number 2.

description: Annette Community Recreation Centre is a recently renovated urban community centre serving the "Junction" and surrounding community. Facilities include a swimming pool, weight room, dance studio and several multipurpose rooms and gymnasium. The pool and facilities are fully accessible with separate special needs washroom/changing facility, pool lift and facility elevator. Programing takes place 7 days a week and facility rental inquires for private functions are welcome.
transit: From Jane station take the 26 Dupont bus and From Runnymend Station take the 71 Runnymede North bus.

description: Antibes Community Centre is a fully accessible Community Centre in the Bathurst St. & Finch Ave. W. area, which offers a variety of recreational programs for all ages. Antibes also serves as a host for many local community groups who use the facility to run their individual programs and events. Come visit Antibes Community Centre, your home away from home!
transit: Travel to Wilson Station. Board the 160 Bathurst North and travel to Drewry . Antibes Dr. is on the west side of the street. Take the right and walk to 140 Antibes dr

description: Agincourt CRC & Leisure Pool is one of only two leisure pools in the Scarborough District providing lessons, recreation swims and birthday parties for all ages. We are home to Agincourt Lions Club, Agincourt Lawnbowling Club, Scarborough Horseshoe Club and Agincourt Tennis Club. Our programmes accomodate participants from Preschoolers to the Older Adult. Two indoor rinks provide ice for hockey and leisure skates. The centre also offers a Snoezelen Room. Please contact the centre for details.
transit: Travel to Kennedy Station. Board the 57 Midland and travel to the farside of Rural. Walk east on Rural to 31 Glen Watford Drive.

description: Bendale pool is located in Bendale BTI. It is a 25 metre tank pool offering lessons and leisure swims.
transit: Travel to Kennedy Station. Board the 57 Midland and travel to Treewood.Walk north to 1555 Midland Ave.

description: The Birchmount Community Centre is a multi-purpose facility with programs & services offered through the Birchmount Bluffs Neighbourhood Centre.Birchmount Leisure Pool is one of two leisure pools in the Scarborough District providing swim lessons, Lane, Leisure and Family swims and birthday parties for all ages. Our features include a sauna, warm conversation pool with jets, a large waterslide, children's shallow area with a children's slide and a spraying elephant. Our programs accommodate participants from Preschoolers to Older Adult.
transit: Travel to Warden Station. Board the 69B Warden South and travel to Danforth Avenue, Walk south to 93 Birchmount Road.

description: Beaches Recreation Centre is the centre of the Beaches community. Preschool and school-aged programs as well as fitness for adults are the mainstays of the program schedule.

description: Boylen Pool is a 25 yard, 5 lane pool. We run a variety of aquatic programs evenings and weekends including swim lessons for all ages, aquafit, leisure swims and leadership courses.

intersection: Avenue Rd. & St. Clair Ave. W

description: Cedarbrae pool is located in Cedarbrae Collegiate Institute. It is a 25 yard tank pool offering swimming lessons and leisure swims.

description: Centennial Recreation Centre West is located one block west of Keele St. on Eglinton Ave. West. It is a shared use facility with the TDSB and is attached to York Memorial C. I. Programming is offered mainly in the evenings and on Saturdays throughout the Fall, Winter and Spring. Summer programming includes camps and instructional swimming. The pool (25 yd 6 lanes) offers a broad spectrum of aquatic programs evenings and weekends, including lessons for all ages, aquafit, leisure swims and leadership courses. Please contact (416) 394-2475 for General & Sports Programs and Camps, (416) 394-2476 for Aquatic Programs.
transit: Travel to Eglinton West Station. Board the 32D Eglinton West and travel to Bicknell. Arrive at 2694 Eglinton Ave West.

description: D.A. Morrison pool is a shared use facility. It features a 25 metre pool, 13 feet at the deepest point, with a large shallow end. This pool offers swimming lessons for all ages and recreational swimming. Please contact the facility for details.

description: Offers a wide variety of programming including an adult fitness club, swimming and skating lessons, leisure swimming and skating, fitness classes, yoga, tai chi, Pilates, Latin dance, watercolour painting, art studio for children, youth club for teens and summer sports camps. Outdoor activities include sports pad, tennis courts, softball diamond, playground and skate park.
transit: Travel to Leslie Station. Board the 51 Leslie and travel to Dexter. Arrive at 6000 Leslie Street.

description: Scarborough Centennial Recreation Centre is a multi-purpose Recreation facility which features a Pool, Hockey & Figure Skating Rinks, Dedicated Pre-school room, Weight Room and an Auditorium. The Centre also has Outdoor facilities which include Beach Volleyball, Basketball and Tennis Courts. The Centre is home to the Scarboro Figure Skating Club, Scarborough Springboard Diving Club, Scarborough Underwater Club and The Centennial Tennis Club. There are a variety of programs and activities for all ages, Pre-schoolers to Older adults.

Dennis R Timbrell is located in the Flemingdon Park Area, near the Ontario Science Centre. It is the hub of a high-density, multi-cultural community. A branch public library and licensed day care centre are part of the complex. Programs are provided for all ages from preschool to older adult from early morning lane swim to late night sport programs.
transit: Travel to Broadview Station. Board the 100 Flemingdon Park and travel to St Dennis. Walk North to 29 St. Dennis Dr.

description: Douglas Snow Aquatic Centre is located north of Sheppard Ave on the west side of Yonge St at the North York Civic Centre subway stop. The centre boasts a 50 metre pool which offers recreational swim programs for all ages including lap swimming, leisure swim and therapy times in the whirlpool. Douglas Snow Aquatic Centre offers a wide range of instructional programming from guardian (parent and tot) to senior learn to swim programs. It has a great aquafit program which runs 5 days a week.
transit: Travel to North York Centre Station. Exit station and walk west for 1/2 a block. Behind North York City Hall.

description: Emery Pool is a 25 yard, 5 lane pool. We run a variety of aquatic programs evenings and weekends including swim lessons for all ages, Aquafit, leisure swims and leadership courses.

description: Earl Beatty offers a wide variety of recreational programs for all ages including: swimming lessons, December, March, and summer day camp, creative arts, ballet, jazz, gymnastics beginner recreational and advanced, caregiver & tot playtime, kindergym, women's sports club, karate beginner intermediate and advanced, soccer houseleague, touch football, t-ball, and ESSO NHL Street Buds, ball hockey. Fitness activities yoga, pilates, and Tai Chi. Youth leadership training in babysitting.
transit: Travel to Coxwell Station. Exit station and walk north on Coxwell and then east on Glebeholme Blvd to number 455.

description: East York Community Centre offers the full spectrum of programs for perschool to older adult, we have it all. Come on over and check us out!!!

description: Fairmount is a shared use facility that offers programs in 2 large community spaces. School age art and dance programs and adult fitness are the main programs.

description: Harrison Pool is located Queen and Mccaul St. The pool is 20 yards. The building is also open for shower use.

description: Gordon A. Brown pool is a shared use facility. It features a 25yd pool with a large shallow end. It is approximately 3 metres deep in the deep end. This pool offers recreational swimming and swimming lessons for all ages. Please contact the facility for details.

description: Attached to one of the Toronto District School Board schools (Hillcrest Public School), Hillcrest Community Centre offers programs and activities for resident of all ages. pool: Gus Ryder Pool And Health Club
description: Gus Ryder is a City of Toronto Type B Club which offers 24 diverse fitness classes per week and a variety of cardio equipment for individual use. Our weight room offers a multiple range of free weights and an assortment of multi-purpose strength machines. Body bars and stability balls are available for individual and class use. Our pool is a warm 25 yard pool with chair lift and stairs. We offer swimming lessons, Aquafit and arthritis Aquafit classes, public swims, family swims, and lane swims.
transit: Travel to Kipling Station. Board the 44 Kipling South and travel to Birmingham. Walk west to 1 Faustina Drive

description: A small, community-oriented facility located on the north campus of Humber College (Hwy 27 and Finch area). Humber Community Pool is known as a friendly place to swim and socialize and is popular with the families and older adults in the community. In addition to a multitude of daily recreational swims, Humber Pool offers swimming lessons 7 days a week and extensive leadership programming.
transit: Travel to Kipling Station. Board the 191 Highway 27 Rocket and travel to the farside of Hwy 27. Walk west to 205 Humber College Blvd.

description: A large facility located in the Logan St. Queen St. area. Jimmie Simpson Community Centre is known as a priority centre hub for recreational programming with a variety of opportunities for everyone from pre-school to older adults. It offers a wide-range of activities including fitness, youth, sports, after-school and pre-school programs. Jimmie Simpson Artificial Ice rink is located inside Jimmie Simpson park. The ice rink features at hockey pad which is also a please pad. There change rooms for changing into skates. There tennis courts and a soccer field in the park.
transit: Travel to Queen Station. Board the 501 Queen and travel to Empire. Walk east to number 870

description: Pearson pool is unique in its design as it has the availablitlity of a one meter diving platforms and boards. This facility is also used for structured insturctional lessons, recreational swim times and pool permits.

description: Joseph J. Piccininni is one of the largest facilities in Toronto. We offer a variety of programs for everyone from preschoolers to older adults, all of which are located in accessible areas. The pool offers programs including swimming lessons, lane swim, aqua fitness, leisure swim, leadership courses, fitness, sports, female only swims and much more Our B facility Health Club has all new cardio, muscular strength and free weight equipment and knowledgeable staff to assist and guide you. Fitness classes and swimming included with all membership options.
transit: Travel to St Clair West Station. Board the 512 St Clair and travel to Lansdowne. Walk west to 1369 St Clair Ave W.

description: John Innes Community Centre is located in the Moss Park Neighbourhood of downtown Toronto. It offers a wide variety of programs for all ages
transit: Travel to Queen Station. Board the 501 Queen and travel to Sherbourne. Walk north to 150 Sherbourne St.

description: Leaside Memorial Pool is located in the neighborhood of Leaside. Leaside has a wheel chair accessible lift and elevator to the pool area and a multi-access change room. Leaside offers instructional swim lessons for all ages as well as recreation swim times.*Note: Leaside Memorial Gardens Arena is currently working on the construction of a second arena to the complex. As such, construction has begun and will ongoing for the immediate future. The Leaside Memorial Gardens Pool entrance will now be accessible only through the original Leaside Memorial Gardens Arena entrance. Cars will not be able to access the drop off area and pool users must walk through the arena to enter the pool. Parking has also been significantly reduced.
transit: Travel to Eglinton Station. Board the 56 Leaside and travel to Millwood Rd. Walk South West on Southvale Dr to 1073 Millwood Rd.

description: This popular tank pool hosts both structured aquatic lessons as well as recreational swim times.
transit: Travel to Finch Station. Board the 39E Finch East and travel to Warden On the northbound side of Warden, board the 68 Warden and travel to Bridletown N. Walk east to 2501 Bridletown Circle.

description: Pine Point Outdoor Pool features a large deck area with a beach entry and water spray features, ideal for young children. An in-water bench with therapeutic jets is a great area to sit and relax! Our schedule features swimming lessons for all ages, youth lifeguard club, leadership programs and water polo. Recreational swims are offered afternoons and evenings.
transit: Travel to Islington Station. Board the 37A Islington and travel to Allenby. Walk east on Allenby and then south to 15 Grierson Road

description: Welcome to Park Lawn Outdoor Pool! This community pool is host to a broad spectrum of aquatic programs including swim lessons for all ages and swimming abilities, family, leisure and length swim. In addition, Park Lawn offers a fun opportunity for children and youth to further develop their swimming skills as part of a recreational swim team. Situated adjacent to tennis courts and a play structure, Park Lawn Pool and Park is a great place to spend a summer day!
transit: Travel to Old Mill Station. Board the 66A Prince Edward and travel to the farside of Park Lawn. Walk north to 340 Park Lawn Road.

description: Pleasantview Community Centre is a multi-purpose facility in the Victoria Park and Finch area.  This facility offers programs for preschoolers, children, youth, adults and older adults. Rooms are available for groups to permit.
transit: Travel to Finch Station. Board the 39E Finch East and travel to Cherokee. Walk south on Cherokee, then west on Faye Dr. And then south on Lucifer Dr to Van Horne Ave. Walk to number 545.

description: This 18-hectare park near Danforth and Broadveiw Avenues is popular for winter toboganning and views of downtown Toronto skyline. Riverdale Park East features two ball diamonds, three multi-purpose sports fields, a running track, seven tennis courts, an artifical outdoor ice rink and ball hockey pad, a picnic area and a children's playground. The ice rink features a hockey pad which is also a please pad. There are change rooms for changing into skates. There is a nice playground to the east of the rink. A naturalized area at the north end of the park has many recreational trails idea for walking. Located at the north entrance to the park on Broadview Ave is the Riverdale Park East Outdoor Pool.
transit: Take the Broadview streetcar two stops past the Danforth and walk down the stairs to the rink.

description: Richmond Gardens Pool is located within Silver Creek Park. Featuring newly renovated large changerooms, and a family changeroom with an accessible shower area. Stairs with a railing make entering and exiting the pool easy for all ages. Our schedule features swimming lessons for all ages. Recreational swims are offered afternoons and evenings.
transit: Travel to Eglinton West Station. Board the 32B Eglinton West and travel to Wincott. Walk north on Wincott and the east to 44 Strathdee Drive.

description: This 3 level facility houses a 25 metre pool, 2 multi purpose areas, a kitchen, and a small weight room.. We have lockers, showers and changerooms on the third floor. We offer a wide range of programming for all ages.
transit: Travel to Main Street Station. Exit the station and walk south to 245 Main Street.

description: Roding Community Centre is located in the Keele and Wilson area. The centre is on the north side of Roding Park and is home to many community groups and a very popular aftershool program.

A 15.3 hectare park along the Black Creek ravine between Jane St and Scarlett Rd north of St Clair Ave West. This park features trails along the Black Creek, three ball diamonds (one with lights), a splash pad and a children's playground. At the east end of the park is the Smythe Park Outdoor Pool. Smythe Park Outdoor Pool is located in the heart of Smythe Park, nearest intersection is Jane Street and St Clair Avenue West. This facility includes a baby/tot pool and there is a Splash Pad located at the nearby park. Our recreational swims include daily afternoon and evening Leisure Swims and evening Lane Swims. Swimming lessons are not offered.

Smithfield Outdoor Pool is located in Smithfield Park, near a popular skateboard area. Part of the extended hours program, Smithfield is open until 11:45pm on designated hot nights. Swimming lessons are offered in the mornings. Our recreational swim schedule features adult lane swim.
transit: Travel to Kipling Station. Board the 191 Highway 27 Rocket and travel to Silverstone Walk east on Silverstone and then south to 173 Mount Olive Drive.

description: Welcome to Rotary Outdoor Pool! This fully accessible, newly renovated community pool is located in a picturesque park steps from the waterfront. We offer a very large and popular learn to swim program, catering to all ages and abilities, weekday mornings. Afternoon, evening and weekend aquatic programming includes adult aquafit, leisure, family and lane swimming opportunities. In addition, Rotary Pool offers a fun opportunity for children and youth to further develop their swimming skills with both a recreational swim and waterpolo team. Situated next to tennis courts and a playground area, the park and pool are the perfect place to spend a summer day!
transit: Travel to Osgoode Station. On the westbound side of Queen, board the 501 Queen and travel to 10th. Walk west to 11th St. and south to number 25.

description: Welcome to Sunnyside/Gus Ryder Outdoor Pool - enjoy a wonderful day along Toronto's vibrant lakeshore; located at the foot of Lakeshore Blvd. & Parkside Drive. You can access Sunnyside by car (metered parking after 4pm and on weekends), walking and bicycle paths located directly north and south of the pool while enjoying morning swimming lessons for all ages followed by public and adult width swims every day.
transit: Take the 501 Queen St streetcar to The Queensway and Parkside drive. Head south to the Lakeshore pedestrian/bike path. Walk west to Sunnyside/Gus Ryder Pool. This route takes 5 minutes to walk, and is only 390 meters

description: Westmount Outdoor Pool is a hidden gem, located within Westmount Park. Next to tennis courts and a playground area, this quiet park and pool are the perfect area for a fun family day!
transit: Travel to Runnymede Station. Board the 79 Scarlett Road and travel to the farside of La Rose. Walk west on La Rose and then North west to 22 Arcade Drive.

pool: West Mall Outdoor Pool - Outdoor Pool
description: Welcome to West Mall Outdoor Pool! This fully accessible community pool offers a broad spectrum of aquatic programs including swim lessons for all ages and abilities, an adapted and integrated aquatic program, a children's recreational swim team, and both leisure and lane swimming. Situated next to a ball hockey arena, tennis courts and playground, the pool and park are the perfect place to spend a summer afternoon!
transit: Travel to Islington Station. Board the 50 Burnhamthorpe and travel to West Mall. Walk south to 370 The West Mall

description: Westgrove Outdoor Pool is located at the north end of Westgrove Park, adjacent to tennis courts. We offer swim lessons for all ages, as well as adult lane swim and family swim, for children and adults to come together.
transit: Travel to Kipling Station. Board the 46 Martin Grove and travel to Westway. Walk west to 15 Redgrave Drive.

description: Welcome to Wedgewood pool! This Outdoor Pool is located in a quiet residential neighbourhood, in a park setting. We offer a very popular learn to swim and leadership program, catering to all ages and abilities, weekday mornings. Afternoon, evening and weekend aquatic programming include leisure, family and length swimming opportunities. Wedgewood Pool is also home to a very popular children's recreational swim team - Splash. We strive to meet the needs of the community and make every visit enjoyable for the whole family.
transit: Travel to Islington Station. Board the 50 Burnhamthorpe and travel to the farside of Martin Grove. Walk south on Martin Grove then west to 17 Swan Avenue.

description: Welcome to West Deane Outdoor Pool! We offer swim lessons, for all ages and abilities, weekday mornings. Leisure swim, adult swim, and family swim are offered afternoons, evenings and weekends. Situated next to a newly renovated play structure, in the middle of very spacious West Deane Park, this community pool is a hidden gem!
transit: Travel to Royal York Station. Board the 48 Rathburn and travel to Cottrelle. Walk north on Cottrelle going north west on Archerhill. Follow Archerhill North west and then go east at Sedgebrook Drive. Arrive at 19 Sedgebrook Dr.

description: A 7.4 hecatre park on the east bank of the Humber River at Lawrence Ave and Weston Rd. This park features two ball diamonds including one with lights, a lighted artificial turf sports field, four lighted tennis courts, a skateboard area, a basketball court, a splash pad and a children's playground. Also locate near the park entrance is the Weston Lions Park Outdoor Pool and Weston Arena.Welcome to Weston Lions Outdoor Pool - We offer the perfect outing for all families with 2 pools that can satisfy all water needs. We offer leadership training and junior lifeguard club on weekday mornings followed by afternoon and evening public swimmin
transit: Travel to Lawrence West Station. Board the 58B Malton and travel to Little. Arrive at 2125 Lawrence Avenue.

description: Mary McCormick has a fully stocked fitness facility with cardio, free weights, and nautilis equipment. A 25yd warm water pool with viewing gallery, large gymnasium, fitness, dance and yoga studios. Two large preschool rooms, youth and older adult lounges.
transit: Travel to St. Patrick station. Board the 505 Dundas and travel to Sheridan. Walk southto 66 Sheridan Ave.

description: Regent Park Aquatic Centre (RPAC) is the newest development in the Toronto/East York District. This stand alone aquatic facility is located in the heart of Regent Park and features a Lap Pool, Leisure Pool, Warm Water Pool, Tarzan Rope, Diving Board and Water Slide. Our universal changerooms allow for full accessibility for all patrons. Our programs accommodate participants from preschoolers to older adults. This centre is easily accessible by transit, bike, and foot.
transit: Travel on 505 Dundas streetcar to DUNDAS ST E at SUMACH stop; or travel on 65 Parliament bus to PARLIAMENT at DUNDAS stop, walk east to 640 Dundas St.

description: Memorial Pool and Health Club is a newer facility, located in a quiet residential neighbourhood, just off Montgomery Road. A wide variety of aquatic programming is offered weekdays, weeknights and weekends. This includes a vast learn to swim program, popular Aquafit classes, an extensive leadership program, and leisure and lane swimming opportunities for persons of all ages and abilities. We strive to meet the needs of the entire community and make every visit enjoyable for the whole family. Memorial Health Club is City of Toronto Type B location which offers a variety of services to assist in personal Health and Wellness. Our co-ed Health Club is equipped with a variety of cardio and strength equipment. We offer a wide range of aerobic classes for those who enjoy a group setting led by a qualified fitness instructor.
transit: travel to Royal York Station. Walk north on Royal York Rd and then west on Wilgar Rd. Walk north west to 44 Montgomery Road.

description: Matty Eckler is a facility that provides programs at quality level training at cost effective prices available to all. It is a friendly and community oriented Community Recreation Centre located south-east corner of Pape Ave. and Gerrard St.

description: A Community School located south of Bloor Street, 1 block east of Islington Avenue, on Norseman Avenue. We are a Community School, that also has a pool on site. We offer a wide range of programs from sports, dance, and music, to fitness and preschool. Programs are available from preschool to older adults. The 25 meter Norseman Community Pool offers both recreational and learn-to-swim programs to all ages and abilities. Norseman Pool is also known for it's daytime aqua fitness classes focusing on the older adult population. Norseman is also home to the Norseman Masters Aquatic Club as well as offering a popular recreational swim team program (Splash) to children in the community.
transit: Travel to Islington Station. Board the 110A Islington South and travel to Norseman. Walk east to 105 Norseman St

description: Parkdale Community Centre is fully accessible shared use facility. It is located one block north of Queen St. west on Lansdowne Avenue in historical Parkdale. It features a 25m pool, a separate wading pool, two gymnasiums which can accommodate a variety of activities, and a community room and limited access to a full function kitchen. Permits are also available for your next family get together, i.e., birthday parties, baby showers, community meetings, special events. Please contact the facility for more program & access information.
transit: Travel to St. Andrew's Station. On westbound side of Queen board the 501 Queen and travel to Lansdowne. Walk north to 75 Lansdowne Ave.

description: Please contact the Community Centre for more information

description: Laurier pool is located in Sir Wilfred Laurier Collegiate Institute. It is a standard tank pool offering swimming lessons and leisure swims.
